title: Unlimited holiday schemes sound like a dream — until you’re picking up someone else’s slack
content:
Unlimited annual leave — it’s the dream, right? Going from a set number of days at your previous employer to a new company where the world is your oyster (in holiday terms) can feel exciting, liberating — and potentially a little bit scary. Will you ever get any work done? The concept of unlimited holiday leave originated in the mid-1990s within the tech industry in Silicon Valley. IBM was an early adopter, and despite often being decried as a PR, rather than HR, tool its adoption has spread globally and there are now UK-owned and operated tech companies offering it…

description: What could be a better workplace perk than the freedom to take as many holidays as you want? Here are a few caveats to unlimited vacation.
